programme.title: The Ashes Live
programme.desc: Australia v England. Coverage of day three of the Second Test in the five-match series, held at Brisbane Cricket Ground. England have not won a Test at this venue since an Ian Botham-inspired seven-wicket triumph all the way back in 1986. Since then the sides have faced each other nine times in this format, with the visitors only managing to avoid defeat twice, when they drew in 1998 and 2010.

programme.title: Live: NFL Football
programme.desc: The AFC West-leading Broncos (10-2) line up against the rival Raiders (2-10). Denver ran its win streak to nine games with a 27-26 overtime win at Washington on Sunday night. Included in that stretch is a 10-7 win over Las Vegas in Week 10.

programme.desc: The RedHawks (7-5) eye a second MAC championship in three years as they face the Broncos (8-4). Miami (Ohio) won a 15th MAC title in 2023 but failed to repeat last year, falling 38-3 to Ohio in the final. Miami beat Western Michigan 26-17 on Oct. 25.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Red Raiders and Cougars make their debuts in the Big 12 title game. Both teams are 11-1. Texas Tech beat BYU 29-7 in November. The Raiders held the Cougars to 67 rushing yards in that contest, well below their 194.5 season average.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Crimson Tide (10-2) and Bulldogs (11-1) meet in the SEC championship game for the third time in five years. Alabama is 4-0 against Georgia in SEC title contests. The Bulldogs yielded a total of 22 points in the last three outings.

programme.desc: The AFC West-leading Broncos (10-2) line up against the rival Raiders (2-10). Denver ran its win streak to nine games with a 27-26 overtime win at Washington on Sunday night. Included in that stretch is a 10-7 win over Las Vegas in Week 10.

programme.desc: "Football Night in America" features host Maria Taylor, Hall of Fame head coach Tony Dungy, former NFL head coach and quarterback Jason Garrett, former NFL quarterback Chris Simms and NFL insider Mike Florio recapping the day's NFL highlights. Co-host Jac Collinsworth and two-time Super Bowl champion Rodney Harrison contribute on-site each week.
